newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Dickson to offer 2.65 mln ST Dupont shrs.
newsitem.headline: Dickson to offer 2.65 mln ST Dupont shrs.

text.p: Dickson Concepts International Ltd said on Tuesday that it had agreed to offer 2.65 million shares in its unit ST Dupont at 180 French francs per share, with a possible over-allotment option of 397,000 shares.
"The offer price has been set at 180 French francs per share," chairman Dickson Poon told a news conference.
Dickson Concepts said it is offering between 43.4 percent to 49.9 percent of its French subsidiary.

Merrill Lynch International and Banque Nationale de Paris are acting as the lead managers for the offer with 2.12 million shares to be placed with institutions and 530,000 shares to be offered to the public in France.
The total value of all the shares of ST Dupont will be 1.1 billion francs or about HK$1.61 billion.
"If 2.65 million shares are sold, ST Dupont will become a 56.6 percent owned subsidiary of the company," said Edwin Ing, Dickson Concept's executive director.
Net proceeds of the offer will be about 396.1 million french francs, or HK$574.3 million, the company said.

If the over-allotment option is exercised in full, ST Dupont would become a 50.1 percent indirect subsidiary of Dickson Concepts, and the total net proceeds of the offer would be 457.7 million francs, or HK$668.2 million.
If the 2.65 million existing shares are sold, Dickson Concepts said it expects to book an exceptional profit, net of expenses, of 227.2 million francs, or HK$331.7 million.
